title: This dude is literally the strongest league character lore-wise.
body:
https://i.ytimg.com/vi/b_0DJSnIlUw/maxresdefault.jpg


He's immortal , he never actually dies.

replies.body: Too bad he/she (even Kled does not know its gender) is a fucking bitch and leaves you when you need it the most. Just like my dad.
Skaarl was confirmed female in the Kled AMA. Kled doesn't know her gender though and probably doesn't much care.
so kled is "riding" her hmmmmm

In the same sense Banjo rides Kazooie, yes.

Don't put that into Google, kids.

its too late.

ive gone too far.

im not gonna make it captain.

**tell my wife and kids i love them**

> [{quoted}](name=Toxic Control,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=lFAK5eXA,comment-id=0002000100000000,timestamp=2017-06-30T22:52:40.660+0000)
>
> In the same sense Banjo rides Kazooie, yes.
> 
> Don't put that into Google, kids.

mfw
http://gamefabrique.com/storage/screenshots/n64/banjo-kazooie-02.png
And if they ever come back it's always too late.
To bad he only runs away
Skaarl doesn't run away, she (?) retreats to advance from a different location
Yes, she. And i thought it was just advancing towards future victory?
Well. Could he kill a Star Dragon?
Could an immortal fly kill a star dragon?  Probably not.  Just means it is a tie.
WE don't know how immortal skarrl really is though. infact why would it be afraid at all if it was truly immortal.

What if Skaarl fears being traumatized?  If I were immortal I would make extra sure to steer clear of anything that would cause undue emotional stress, because there can be no escape from that.  The pain of watching love ones murdered, corpses scattered across the ground, knowing you will never see them again.... and having to deal with that for an eternity, no escape, no release...

Alternatively Skaarl is just an idiot.

I don't think skaarl is afraid of being traumatized. everything kled does is traumatizing.

And skaarl might be stupid, but stupid doesn't equal out to a ~~fight or~~ flight response. Infact I would argue that it means the other.

Instead I reckon to say skaarl doesn't age, and knows exactly when to retreat to keep himself alive. Probably friends with kled because kled makes for one hell of a distraction.
being afraid is how you STAY immortal
Skarrl is just too stupid to acknowledge the fact that it's immortal :U

> [{quoted}](name=Fondling Gems,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=lFAK5eXA,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-06-30T16:09:09.135+0000)
>
> Could an immortal fly kill a star dragon?  Probably not.  Just means it is a tie.

I'm pretty sure a normal fly could kill a star dragon. DO YOU HAVE ANY IDEA HOW ANNOYING THOSE THINGS ARE??

BBZZzzZZZZ
-swat
....
BzZZZZZZZ
-swat swat swat
(silence)
yay i got it!
....
#BZZzzZZZZzZZZZ
......

yep, that's one dead dragon.
If saitama can't catch a fly, no one can

> [{quoted}](name=XeroKimo,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=lFAK5eXA,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2017-06-30T22:39:28.964+0000)
>
> If saitama can't catch a fly, no one can

So there we have it kids, the frog on the Rift beats everything in League.
(No, not the one that turns into Gromp, I'm talking about the little one that appears in lower river sometimes before minions spawn.)

frog > fly > saitama > sol/bard/kindred  > everyone else

https://bossip.files.wordpress.com/2017/04/bill-oreilly1.jpg
That's some next level shit right there.
{{champion:136}} /{{champion:161}} ?
What makes you think vel koz is immortal? Literally nothing states this ever

it asol's lore he is described as being as powerful as asol himself, a void equivalent per say he said he "feared to think what would happen if that thing came into this world"  when he sees velkoz in the void
Aurelian Sol's lore did not say that was Vel'koz. I highly doubt it was Vel'koz.

while it wasnt specifically described as velkoz, it was described as a being who could make a rift, and velkoz is the only one who can do that (his w)
plus, if you watch velkoz's champion teaser and read his lore, he is emerging from a similar rift

Skarl is more than just immortal

what sets Skarl aside from the divine beings you set out in front of me is that Skarl is also Indestructible

not once have I seen Skarl hit 0 HP and die

every time Skarl was to hit "0 HP" Skarl just runs away

Giant Star dragon blasts a small lizard with a voice of a thousand suns? Runs away

Anubis smashes the lizard with a cane that has trapped a thousand souls within it? Runs away

Thrown into the godahm void? runs away

Swallowed by Chogath? Runs away

Destroyed and erased from the timeline? Runs away

Rito tries to break its legs with a nerf hammer? Runs away

Edit: Incapable of escaping? Runs away
forgetting all of the darkin

GOOD POINT!

im not sure if Darkin die or not.
they certainly live a long time tho.

Kindred is sorta imaginary.

Bard is immortal but can be killed.

Not sure about tahm actually, I'd assume as a demon there's some way to "kill" him

Anivia is immortal but loses memories/can be corrupted each renewal.

A-Sol admitted there are beings more powerful then him. 

Ascended beings are are not immortal if i recall. Just very very very very very (etc) long life spans. 
 
Brand is a fire spirit sorta immortal.

Galio isn't really.... Alive... In the traditional sense. 

Malphite is a mountain. Mountains decay.

Mord is bound to his skull

Nasus/Renek/Azir- See above

Idk about yorick..

Zil is debatable? Not quite sure. tbh.

Gameplay wise Skarl legit doesn't take dmg.

Ofc I'm going partially into "strongest character lore wise" not just immortality.
Ascended are confirmed to be killable. Sivir's blade belonged to an Ascended named Setaka who was killed in Icathia. I don't now if they naturally age though, however slowly.

(psst forgot a k)

I'm pretty sure it was mentioned they do age...

Tahm is special.

His physical form can be destroyed, but as the embodiment of an idea, he will never "die" so long as suffering exists in the world.
He can always manifest a new body.
---
I guess there was a condition there that allows him do die, though, wasn't there? I guess if there was nothing living in the world Kindred would cease to exist too.--since she's the embodiment of death, having nothing left that can die would destroy her.

> [{quoted}](name=Kaeblen,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=lFAK5eXA,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-06-30T19:17:47.453+0000)

Nasus and Renekton are not immortal. They just live for really long time.

???
I thought I said that?
"totally - not - immortal"

they just look immortal to some people.
short sighted fools...

> [{quoted}](name=Kaeblen,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=lFAK5eXA,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2017-06-30T19:17:47.453+0000)

> totally, NOT immortal.

What about Xerath he'd be the third most powerful champion of that group and that's assuming bard is more powerful as we don't know much of him
Bard is immortal but can be killed. Just a lore tidbit.

Different kinds of immortality. Most of these dudes could theoretically be killed, even if they could live indefinitely. Skarl is impervious to damage of any sort. She can't be killed and seemingly doesn't age.
pretty sure asol and vel are immortal
Kled needs a Jurrasic Park skin with a Kled Spitter.

This^

Also I want to see a JarJar Binks Skarl (since as op pit it, Skarl is the strongest in lore/galaxy)
{{champion:30}} {{champion:203}} triggered
I remember a rioter saying her life is tied to those plains she lives in. Like, if those plains were destroyed, by like a giant star dragon, Skaarl would die too.
SHE

he always backs off when the idiot riding him takes too much damage. just like a good support.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}
Also immortality doesn't equal most powerful cause skaarl can be easily put into a situation where they can't do anything by someone like A-sol
But it would be at least a draw, since Skaarl can't be killed.
{{champion:136}}
The one character smart enough to run away...
